{
  "overview": "The purpose of this Act is to emphasize the importance of compliance with the requirements enacted by Acts 62 and 199. [CHUNK_3] The bill explicitly states that the defense of good faith compliance is unavailable to any condominium association whose board adopts a budget that omits the required budget summary. [CHUNK_4] It also clarifies the ability to enforce compliance with budget summary and replacement reserves requirements and provides that an association has the burden of proving compliance. [CHUNK_12]",
  "appropriations": "This measure does not contain an appropriation. [CHUNK_0] No funding for staffing, operations, or any other purpose is mentioned in the provided text. [CHUNK_1] The Act shall take effect upon its approval without any associated financial allocation. [CHUNK_11]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "This measure has no fiscal impact, and therefore, no financial projections have been calculated. [CHUNK_0] The bill amends statutory language regarding legal defenses and the burden of proof in civil actions between condominium owners and their associations. [CHUNK_4] It does not create any new programs or responsibilities for the State, thus it is assumed to have no cost. [CHUNK_9]",
  "agency_impact": "This bill is not expected to have any operational, administrative, or budgetary impact on any state agency. [CHUNK_0] The measure amends statutes that govern condominium associations and enforcement actions are to be brought by unit owners. [CHUNK_9] No new duties or supervisory roles are assigned to any government body. [CHUNK_8]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided legislative text does not describe any specific economic effects, such as cost savings or revenue generation for the State. [CHUNK_0] The bill's stated purpose is to better inform owners of the financial condition of an association by emphasizing compliance with disclosure requirements. [CHUNK_3] There is no quantifiable economic impact on the State detailed in the measure. [CHUNK_13]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act amends Section 514B-148, Hawaii Revised Statutes, related to condominium budgets and reserves. [CHUNK_5] The bill is designed to emphasize the importance of compliance with requirements previously enacted by Act 62, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, and Act 199, Session Laws of Hawaii 2023. [CHUNK_3] It modifies state policy by making the defense of good faith unavailable for certain non-compliant associations and clarifies that a unit owner has standing to bring an action to enforce compliance. [CHUNK_7]",
  "revenue_sources": "This measure does not identify or create any new revenue sources for the State. [CHUNK_0] The bill does not involve general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams. [CHUNK_1] All provisions are related to legal compliance and enforcement within private condominium associations. [CHUNK_12]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "This measure will have no fiscal implications for the State of Hawaii over the next six years. [CHUNK_0] The bill does not appropriate any funds or authorize any expenditures. [CHUNK_1] No new state positions are created or required to implement its provisions. [CHUNK_2] The purpose of the Act is to emphasize compliance with existing laws for condominium associations. [CHUNK_3] It explicitly states that the defense of good faith compliance is unavailable to any condominium association whose board adopts a budget that omits the required budget summary. [CHUNK_4] Additionally, it provides that an association has the burden of proving compliance. [CHUNK_4] Any unit owner shall have standing to bring an action alleging a violation of this section against an association. [CHUNK_9] The association shall have the burden of proving substantial compliance with this section in any such action. [CHUNK_10] As the enforcement mechanism is through private action and does not involve state resources, no impact on state funds is anticipated for the six-year period. [CHUNK_13]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "This measure is not anticipated to have any impact on the State's operating revenues. [CHUNK_0] The bill's provisions do not create new fees, fines payable to the state, or other mechanisms that would generate revenue. [CHUNK_1] The focus is on the internal governance of condominium associations and legal remedies for unit owners. [CHUNK_9]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "This measure will have no impact on state capital expenditures. [CHUNK_0] The bill does not authorize or require any state investment in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure. [CHUNK_1] All provisions relate to the financial disclosures and legal compliance of condominium associations, not state capital projects. [CHUNK_12]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "This measure is expected to have no ongoing fiscal obligations for the State beyond the six-year period. [CHUNK_0] As the bill has no initial or recurring costs to the State, no annual operating costs are anticipated in the future. [CHUNK_1] The measure does not establish any state-operated programs or facilities that would require sustained funding. [CHUNK_2]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "A previous fiscal note was not provided in the source documents. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, a comparison of updates is not possible. [CHUNK_1] This analysis is based exclusively on the text of H.B. No. 70. [CHUNK_0]"
}
